required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Study of the Efficacy and Safety of BCD-089 in Combination With Methotrexate in Patients With Active Rheumatoid Arthritis
clinical_study.official_title: An International, Multicenter, Randomized, Double-blind, Placebo-controlled Clinical Study of the Efficacy and Safety of BCD-089 (JSC BIOCAD, Russia) in Combination With Methotrexate in Patients With Active Rheumatoid Arthritis

brief_summary.textblock:
BCD-089 is the original therapeutic monoclonal antibody binding the alpha subunit of the IL-6 receptor.
The aim of the study is to demonstrate the efficacy and safety of BCD-089 in combination with methotrexate in patients with active rheumatoid arthritis resistant to monotherapy with methotrexate.

detailed_description.textblock:
BCD-089-3/SOLAR is the international, multicenter, double blind, placebo-controlled phase III clinical study.
The main period of the study (Weeks 0-24) is blinded; study subjects will receive BCD-089/placebo.
At Week 24 the study will become open-label and all patients will receive BCD-089 once a week for 4 weeks. At week 28 patients who achieved the RA remission at week 24 will be switched to BCD-089 Q2W dosing regimen and will receive it through Week 51. Patients who failed to achieve remission at week 24 will receive BCD-089 once a week through Week 51.

primary_outcome.description: The proportion of patients with low disease activity according to DAS28-CRP(4) (< 3,2)

secondary_outcome.description: The proportion of patients who required rescue therapy
The proportion of patients who achieved RA remission according to DAS28-CRP(4) (< 2.6)
The proportion of patients who achieved RA remission according to CDAI (≤ 2.8)
The proportion of patients who achieved RA remission according to SDAI (≤ 3.3)

secondary_outcome.measure: Remission according to the ACR/EULAR 2011 criteria
secondary_outcome.description: The proportion of patients who achieved remission
The proportion of ACR20 responders
The proportion of ACR50 responders
The proportion of ACR70 responders

secondary_outcome.measure: Low RA activity according to DAS28-ESR(4)
secondary_outcome.description: The proportion of patients who achieved low RA activity according to DAS28-ESR(4) (< 3.2)

secondary_outcome.measure: Low RA activity according to CDAI
secondary_outcome.description: the proportion of patients who achieved low RA activity according to CDAI (≤ 10)

secondary_outcome.measure: Low RA activity according to SDAI
secondary_outcome.description: The proportion of patients who achieved low RA activity according to SDAI (≤ 11)
The change from baseline in the DAS28-CRP(4)
The change from baseline in the CDAI
The change from baseline in the SDAI

secondary_outcome.measure: Moderate/good response according to the EULAR criteria
secondary_outcome.description: The proportion of patients with moderate/good response according to the EULAR criteria

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in concentration of C-reactive protein
secondary_outcome.description: The change from baseline in the concentration of C-reactive protein in serum
The change from baseline in the erythrocyte sedimentation rate (ESR)

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in the quality of life measured with SF-36
secondary_outcome.description: The change from baseline in the patient's quality of life measured with the SF-36 score

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in the quality of life measured with the EQ-5D-3L
secondary_outcome.description: The change from baseline in the patient's quality of life measured with the EQ-5D-3L

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in the Functional Assessment of Chronic Illness Therapy - Fatigue (FACIT-F) score
secondary_outcome.description: The change in the FACIT-F score. The level of fatigue is measured on a four point Likert scale (4 = not at all fatigued to 0 = very much fatigued) (Webster et al., 2003)

The change in functional activity according to the HAQ-DI (Health Assessment Questionnaire without Didability Index) score. The value of the HAQ-DI index can be interpreted in terms of three categories: from 0 to 1: mild difficulties to moderate disability, from 1 to 2: disability moderate to severe, from 2 to 3: severe to very severe disability.
The change in mTSS score according to Sharp/van der Heijde (SvH) scoring method

reference.citation: Mazurov V.I., Korolev M.A., Prystrom A.M., Kunder E.V., Soroka N.F., Kastanayan A.A., Povarova T.V., Plaksina T.V., Antipova O.V., Kretchikova D.G., Smakotina S.A., Tciupa O.A., Puntus E.V., Raskina T.A., Shilova L.N., Kropotina T.V., Nesmeyanova O.B., Popova T.A., Vinogradova I.B., Linkova Yu.N., Dokukina E.A., Plotnikova A.V., Pukhtinskaia P.S., Zinkina-Orikhan A.V., Eremeeva A.V., Lutckii A.A. Effectiveness and safety of levilimab in combination with methotrexate in treatment of patients with active rheumatoid arthritis resistant to methotrexate monotherapy (double-blinded randomized placebo controlled phase III clinical study SOLAR). Modern Rheumatology Journal. 2021;15(4):13-23. https://doi.org/10.14412/1996-7012-2021-4-13-23
